Package edu.bu.labs.stealth.agents

Class MazeAgent

java.lang.Object
edu.cwru.sepia.agent.Agent
edu.bu.labs.stealth.agents.MazeAgent
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public abstract class MazeAgent extends edu.cwru.sepia.agent.Agent
The base type for Agent's that solve mazes in Sepia. MazeAgents implement a specific state machine that allows them to move from one coordinate on the map to another using a precomputed plan (i.e. a path).

Agents in Sepia must override a few abstract methods, most notably initialStep, middleStep, and terminalStep. All of these methods are handled for you, to both control the API (and prevent you from issuing Sepia compound actions) as well as provide an API for the autograders to use.

In this assignment, you will need to implement two methods: public Path search(Vertex src, Vertex goal, StateView state). This method is called by MazeAgent to calculate the path (called a plan) from the source Vertex to the goal Vertex. Note that the goal Vertex is occupied (by the enemy base), and therefore your plan should not ultimately contain this vertex in it.

public boolean shouldReplacePlan(StateView state) This method is called by MazeAgent to decide if the current plan is no longer valid (for instance if the current plan is blocked by an enemy unit or something). If this method returns true, then MazeAgent will call the search method again to calculate a new plan, which it will then follow.

Here is a description of how the three main Agent methods are implemented:

  • initialStep: This method discovers the unit you control, the enemy base's unit, and all other enemy units present on the map. Once this is complete, this method calls the search method to find a plan from your unit's current location to the location of the enemy's base. The path produced by this method is converted into a Stack of coordinates for internal use.
  • middleStep: This method first calls the shouldReplacePlan method to determine if the current plan is still valid. If shouldReplacePlan returns true, then this method will call search, convert the result to a Stack of coordinates, and overwrite the current plan with this new plan.

    This method will then examine the current position of the unit you control. If the current plan is not empty, this method will try to move the unit to the next position in the current plan, and will fail if the coordinate to move to is not adjacent to the current position of the unit you control. When the plan is exhausted (i.e. there are no more coordinates in the Stack), this unit will try to attack the enemy base. If the unit you control is not adjacent to the enemy base, this method will crash the program.

  • terminalStep: This method prints out the results of the game. There are four possible outcomes:
    • both your unit and the enemy base are killed. This is a tie.
    • the enemy base is killed and you survive. You win.
    • the enemy base survives and your unit is killed. You lose.
    • both the enemy base as well as you survive. This is a tie.

    • getNextVertexToMoveTo

      public final Vertex getNextVertexToMoveTo()
      A getter method to get the next coordinate to move the unit you control to. This is used internally by middleStep just in case movement takes more than a single turn. This is updated every time the unit arrives at this coordinate and is set to the next coordinate in the plan (or null if the plan is empty)
      Returns:
      The coordinate to move the unit you control to.

    • setCurrentPlan

      protected void setCurrentPlan(Stack<Vertex> newPlan)
      A setter method to set the current plan (i.e. Stack of coordinates). middleStep will follow this plan by moving the unit you control to each coordinate in the plan one at a time.
      Parameters:
      newPlan - The new plan to follow in middleStep

    • initialStep

      public Map<Integer,edu.cwru.sepia.action.Action> initialStep(edu.cwru.sepia.environment.model.state.State.StateView state, edu.cwru.sepia.environment.model.history.History.HistoryView history)
      A method to discover all units on the map. There should be only one unit you control, one enemy base, and an arbitrary number of additional units the enemy controls. This method, after discovering the ids of these units and setting fields, will call search to find the plan from your unit's current location to a coordinate adjacent to the enemy base.
      Specified by:
      initialStep in class edu.cwru.sepia.agent.Agent
      Parameters:
      state - The initial state of the game.
      history - The initial history of the game.
      Returns:
      This method returns null and relies on middlestep to do any movement.

    • middleStep

      public Map<Integer,edu.cwru.sepia.action.Action> middleStep(edu.cwru.sepia.environment.model.state.State.StateView state, edu.cwru.sepia.environment.model.history.History.HistoryView history)
      A method to decide what action the unit you control should do every turn. This method decides what to do using the following algorithm:
      • If the current plan is invalid (i.e. this.shouldReplacePlan(state) returns true), then the current plan is replaced by a new plan calculated by search (technically it goes through a separate method called makePlan. This additional method calls search and then converts the Path object to a Stack of coordinates.<\li>
      • If the plan is not empty and the unit you control is not currently at the Vertex to move to, then move to that coordinate. This can fail if the two coordinates are not adjacent.<\li>
      • If the plan is empty, attack the enemy base. If the unit you control is not adjacent to the enemy base, this method will print an error and crash the program.<\li>
      Specified by:
      middleStep in class edu.cwru.sepia.agent.Agent
      Parameters:
      state - The current state of the game
      history - The history of the game up to this turn
      Returns:
      A mapping from every unit id under our control to an Action that we want that unit to do.

    • terminalStep

      public void terminalStep(edu.cwru.sepia.environment.model.state.State.StateView state, edu.cwru.sepia.environment.model.history.History.HistoryView history)
      A method to print out the outcome of the game. There are four possible outcomes:
      • both your unit and the enemy base are killed. This is a tie.
      • the enemy base is killed and you survive. You win.
      • the enemy base survives and your unit is killed. You lose.
      • both the enemy base as well as you survive. This is a tie.
      Specified by:
      terminalStep in class edu.cwru.sepia.agent.Agent
      Parameters:
      state - The last state of the game.
      history - The entire history of the game.

    • makePlan

      protected Stack<Vertex> makePlan(edu.cwru.sepia.environment.model.state.State.StateView state)
      A method to make a new plan from the current state of the game. This method gets the coordinate of the unit you control as well as the coordinate of the enemy base, and then calls the search method, which produces a Path that will lead the unit you control to a coordinate adjacent to the enemy base. This method then creates a Stack of coordinates from this Path, which is used internally by middleStep to move the unit you control.
      Parameters:
      state - The current state of the game.
      Returns:
      The Stack of coordinates to follow, called a plan.

    • getDirectionToMoveTo

      protected edu.cwru.sepia.util.Direction getDirectionToMoveTo(Vertex src, Vertex dst)
      A helper method to calculate the sepia Direction needed to go from the source coordinate to the destination coordiante. This method will return null (and print out an error) if the two coordinates are not adjacent.
      Parameters:
      src - The source coordinate
      dst - The destination coordinate
      Returns:
      The sepia Direction that will move a unit located at the source coordinate to the destination coordinate. Will be null if the two coordinates are not adjacent.

    • hasArrivedAtNextVertex

      protected boolean hasArrivedAtNextVertex(edu.cwru.sepia.environment.model.state.State.StateView state)
      A helper method to determine if the unit you control has arrived at the coordinate returned by getNextVertexToMoveTo. This method will return true if getNextVertexToMoveTo returns null.
      Parameters:
      state - The current state of the game
      Returns:
      true if the coordinate of the unit you control equals the coordinate produced by getNextVertexToMoveTo or if getNextVertexToMoveTo returns null. false otherwise.

    • search

      public abstract Path search(Vertex src, Vertex goal, edu.cwru.sepia.environment.model.state.State.StateView state)
      A abstract method for a graph traversal algorithm that computes the path from the source coordinate to a coordinate adjacent to the goal coordinate using the Path datatype.
      Parameters:
      src - The source coordinate
      goal - The goal coordinate
      state - The current state of the game
      Returns:
      A Path object that implements a path from the source coordinate to a coordinate that is adjacent to the goal coordinate. Do not include the goal coordinate in this path.

    • shouldReplacePlan

      public abstract boolean shouldReplacePlan(edu.cwru.sepia.environment.model.state.State.StateView state)
      A abstract method to determine if the current plan (i.e. a Stack of coordinates) is still valid. Plans can become invalid for a variety of reasons: maybe something has moved in the world and is now blocking one of the coordinates you intend to traverse, or maybe the plan takes your unit too close to an enemy that will kill it, etc.
      Parameters:
      state - The current state of the game
      Returns:
      true if the current plan should be recalculated, false otherwise.
